commits.message:
EUCA-5627 - Clock skew errors should mention the server's current time

Description: If the server or client are off by any amount of time a 403 Forbidden is returned, but the HTTP Date header isn't returned so the user doesn't know the time of the server.

Changes:
 - Handler added to the pipeline to insert the 'Date' header on outbound responses.
 - sendError(), which happens outside of the pipeline, includes the 'Date' header in the response.

Testing:
 - Tested valid responses to ensure that the HTTP Date header was returned.
 - Tested client with different clock to ensure the 403 Forbidden error returns the Date header.
 - Tested responses that already have Date fields (S3), verified that new handler didn't overwrite.
